articles.author: JULIE WALKER and JOHN MINCHILLO
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Walk into any supermarket and you can generally buy a banana for less than $1. But a banana duct-taped to a wall? That might sell for more than $1 million at an upcoming auction at Sotheby’s in New York.
articles.title: How a viral, duct-taped banana came to be worth $1 million

articles.author: DAVID RISING, JILL LAWLESS and NICHOLAS RICCARDI
articles.description: BANGKOK (AP) — Whether on the left or the right, regardless of how long they’ve been in power, sitting governments around the world have been drubbed this year by disgruntled voters in what has been called the “super year” for elections.
articles.title: The 'super year' of elections has been super bad for incumbents as voters punish them in droves

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT and DAN GELSTON
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump walked out to a roaring standing ovation just ahead of the start of the UFC pay-per-view card at Madison Square Garden on Saturday night, combining two things close to his heart: fierce battles inside the octagon and New York City.
articles.title: Trump attends UFC championship fight in New York, taking a break from Cabinet picks

articles.author: FADI TAWIL, BASSEM MROUE and NATALIE MELZER
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — A rare Israeli airstrike on central Beirut killed Hezbollah's chief spokesman on Sunday, an official with the militant group said. Earlier, officials said Israeli strikes killed at least 12 people in the Gaza Strip, where Israel has been at war with the Palestinian Hamas for over a year.
articles.title: A rare Israeli strike on central Beirut kills Hezbollah's spokesman, official says

articles.author: GIADA ZAMPANO
articles.description: ROME (AP) — Pope Francis has called for an investigation to determine if Israel’s attacks in Gaza constitute genocide, according to excerpts released Sunday from an upcoming new book ahead of the pontiff's jubilee year.
articles.title: Pope Francis calls for investigation to determine if Israel's attacks in Gaza constitute 'genocide'

articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia on Sunday launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine, described by officials as the largest in recent months, targeting energy infrastructure and killing civilians.
articles.title: Russia launches one of its fiercest missile and drone attacks at Ukraine's infrastructure

articles.author: HANNA ARHIROVA
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — When Russian tanks rolled into Ukraine in February 2022, the conventional wisdom was that the capital, Kyiv, would soon fall and the rest of the country wouldn’t last long against a much larger enemy.
articles.title: Russia grinds deeper into Ukraine after 1,000 days of grueling war

articles.author: JIM GOMEZ
articles.description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — A powerful typhoon wrecked houses, caused towering tidal surges and forced hundreds of thousands of people to flee to emergency shelters as it cut across the northern Philippines on Sunday in the sixth major storm to hit the country in less than a month.
articles.title: Latest typhoon lashes the Philippines, causing tidal surges and displacing massive numbers of people

articles.author: RUSS BYNUM
articles.description: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) — As the third named storm to emerge during November, Tropical Storm Sara serves as a reminder that the Atlantic hurricane season hasn't quite ended.Sara formed in the western Caribbean Sea before making landfall Thursday on the northern coast of Honduras, dumping torrential rains in a slow weekend crawl across parts of Central America.
articles.title: A third November storm, Sara, serves notice that a busy hurricane season isn't over yet

articles.author: SETH BORENSTEIN and SIBI ARASU
articles.description: BAKU, Azerbaijan (AP) — Distractions were bigger than deals in the first week of United Nations climate talks, leaving a lot to be done, especially on the main issue of money.In week one, not a lot of progress was made on the issue of how much money rich countries should pay to developed ones to move away from dirty fuels and how to cope with rising seas and temperatures and pay for damage already caused by climate-driven extreme weather.
articles.title: As talks in Baku cross the halfway point, nations are no closer to a goal on cash for climate action
